block.p: Christine Bonnet Fulmer, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas S. Fulmer of Princeton, N.J., was married yesterday to Oliver Porter Goss, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Eliot Porter Goss of Jackson Hole, Wyo. The Rev. Peter Chandler, a minister of the Native American Church of the United States of America, performed a nondenominational ceremony at the Bar BC Ranch in Jackson Hole.

Mrs. Goss, 28, graduated from Bowdoin College. In the fall, she will begin her second-year studies for a bachelor's degree in art education at Western Washington University. Her father is a consulting architect in Princeton.

Christine Bonnet Fulmer, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas S. Fulmer of Princeton, N.J., was married yesterday to Oliver Porter Goss, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Eliot Porter Goss of Jackson Hole, Wyo. The Rev. Peter Chandler, a minister of the Native American Church of the United States of America, performed a nondenominational ceremony at the Bar BC Ranch in Jackson Hole.

Mrs. Goss, 28, graduated from Bowdoin College. In the fall, she will begin her second-year studies for a bachelor's degree in art education at Western Washington University. Her father is a consulting architect in Princeton.

Mr. Goss, 33, is a case manager and therapist at the Whatcom Counseling and Psychiatric Clinic in Bellingham, Wash. He graduated from Oberlin College and received a master's degree in social work from Eastern Washington University. His father, an architect, practices in Jackson Hole. The bridegroom is a great-great-grandson of John La Farge, the painter and stained-glass artist.
